version.name: v2.1.0
version.model_difference: Improved handling of thin credit files, integrated new bureau data sources, and tuned feature weights for recent financial behaviors.

identity_and_basic_information.overview: CreditScoreAI is a machine learning model that predicts the likelihood of loan repayment, helping financial institutions assess credit risk more accurately and inclusively.
identity_and_basic_information.citation: Doe, J. & Patel, R. (2025). CreditScoreAI: Enhancing Risk Evaluation in Financial Lending. FinML Journal.
identity_and_basic_information.license: Proprietary â€“ Commercial use with license

source_and_distribution.model_origin: Developed internally by FinML Labs in partnership with regional lending institutions and fintechs.

ontology_and_semantic_maping.structured_taxonomies: FICO Credit Score, TransUnion data schema
ontology_and_semantic_maping.external_factors: Macroeconomic indicators and inflation-adjusted income bands integrated as exogenous variables

model_architecture.input_format: Tabular financial records: JSON or CSV format with preprocessed feature vectors

training_information.training_methodology: Supervised learning with class balancing and synthetic sample generation (SMOTE) for underrepresented borrower profiles
training_information.training_data_overview: 5 million anonymized credit and transaction profiles across 3 years from partnered financial institutions and alternative data providers
training_information.dependencies: Python 3.10, Scikit-learn, XGBoost, PostgreSQL for feature storage

metrics.description: F1 Score on default vs non-default classification at 12-month horizon
metrics.assumptions: 12-month credit behavior horizon; assumes accurate reporting from bureaus

evaluation_and_performance.evaluation_objective: Ensure predictive fairness across demographic groups while maintaining accuracy
evaluation_and_performance.benchmark_standard: FICO and VantageScore benchmarks on equivalent borrower datasets

deployment_and_operations.infrastructure_requirements: Cloud-native with minimum 4 vCPUs, 8GB RAM; PostgreSQL or BigQuery for data backend
deployment_and_operations.deployment_constraints: Model requires real-time data access to current bureau info; must be used in regulated environments
deployment_and_operations.visibility: Available to authorized financial institutions through API portal with audit logs

known_limitations: Biases can persist if upstream bureau data is incorrect or incomplete
Model underperforms for recent immigrants with no credit history
performance_tradeoffs: Higher accuracy can reduce interpretability; tradeoff managed using SHAP explanations
Increased fairness constraints may reduce performance slightly on default prediction

security_and_risk_assessment.robustness: Stress-tested against synthetic profile manipulation (e.g. fraud injection scenarios)
security_and_risk_assessment.confusers: Model may conflate consistent high small loan usage with high risk if not corrected by payment behavior features
security_and_risk_assessment.adversarial_robustness: Penetration-tested against feature spoofing; input sanitation integrated
security_and_risk_assessment.explainability: Integrated SHAP-based dashboard showing feature attribution for each prediction

risk_type: Discriminatory outcomes across racial or income groups
risk.mitigation_strategy: Regular fairness audits; adversarial reweighting applied during training

risk_type: Data leakage from outdated bureau records
risk.mitigation_strategy: Time-bound data validation pipeline with recency filtering

custom_metadata.additional_notes: Model pending certification from National Financial Algorithm Standards Board
custom_metadata.customer_performance_thresholds: Min F1 > 0.8; Disparate Impact Ratio must stay within [0.85, 1.15]
custom_metadata.users: Credit risk analysts, underwriters, fintech credit platforms
custom_metadata.use_cases: Loan pre-qualification, credit risk assessment, dynamic interest rate adjustment
